bio.headline: I'm Zhen & I'm cool
bio.content: I lived in China for 12 years, and lived here in the States for another 12 years. I lived on a street called Kamehameha in Honolulu, Hawaii for 4 months before I moved to California. I am fluent in English, Cantonese, Mandarin, and one of the million Chinese dialects. I rescued two mutts from the animal shelter, a Maltese Mix and a SharPei mix. I am an awesome Ping Pong player and Tennis player. I was formerly a Natinally Registered Emergency Medical Technician, and I hold an achievement in Fire Protection Technology with highest honor.
bio.content2: Peronality wise, I have a knack for making my environment perfect. Everything around me has to be easily accessible and friendly to me. From the general layout of the room to the specific route and length of a TV cable. Same goes for technical & graphic design, every pixel has to be perfect.
bio.content3: I recently obtained a B.S. degree in Human Computer Interaction from the Cognitive Science Department of the University of California, San Diego this past June. While I was there, I also took computer science courses to increase my background and understanding of computer engineering. One of the greatest strength about being a designer with some computer science background is that not only I can handle the graphical aspects of a project, I can understand and handle the technical aspects of the same project as well.
